principle.name: Modularity
principle.description: Keep all main content within separate files in the 'chapters/' directory. The main 'report.tex' file should only be used for preamble configuration, package loading, and including the chapter files.
principle.rationale: This improves organization, reduces merge conflicts, and makes the document easier to manage.

example.scenario: Adding a new section about data analysis.
example.bad: Writing the entire data analysis section directly inside 'report.tex'.

principle.name: Use Semantic Commands
principle.description: Utilize the custom commands provided by 'hcmut-report.cls' (e.g., \title, \coursename, \advisor) for metadata. Avoid hardcoding this information.
principle.rationale: Ensures consistency on the cover page and allows for easy updates.

convention.rule: Place all image files in the 'graphics/' directory. Use consistent and descriptive labels for figures (e.g., fig:model-architecture).
Use the 'booktabs' package (\toprule, \midrule, \bottomrule) for professional-looking tables. Use descriptive labels (e.g., tab:performance-metrics).
Use the 'cleveref' package's \Cref command for cross-referencing to automatically include the type of reference (e.g., "Figure 1.1" instead of just "1.1").
Add all bibliographic entries to 'refs/example.bib'. Do not manually create a bibliography section.

category.name: before_completion
category.item: Ensure all \input commands in 'report.tex' point to existing files.
Run 'latexmk -c' to clean up auxiliary files after a successful compilation.
Verify that all figures, tables, and listings have captions and are referenced in the text.
